person.persName: Alexander McHatton (Hart County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Hart County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Ann Maria Neale McHatton. Father of Francis J. McHatton, Elizabeth McHatton, John B. McHatton, Nancy McHatton, Sarah M. McHatton, Hiram A. McHatton, and Harriett McHatton. Blacksmith in Hart County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Hart County in 1850. Farmer in Hart County in 1860. Served in the 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a sergeant from May 17, 1862, to March 22, 1865. Captured in Rutherford County, Tennessee, on October 7, 1862. Paroled on October 9, 1862. Captured in Cass County, Georgia, on June 6, 1864. Prisoner of war in Camp Morton, Indianapolis, Indiana, from June 30, 1864, to March 22, 1864. Signed a loyalty oath to the U.S. government on March 22, 1864.
